Click the following link to watch video: https://share.newscasts.refinitiv.com/link?entryId=1_zsi4vjrw&referenceId=tag:reuters.com,2022:newsml_OVFT3RCSR_930&pageId=RefinitivNewscasts
Source: Reuters

Description: Walgreens Boots Alliance raised its full-year adjusted profit growth forecast and beat first-quarter earnings estimates on Thursday, as the company benefits from strong demand for COVID-19 vaccinations and testing. Fred Katayama reports.
Short Link: https://refini.tv/3n1zYhl

Video Transcript:

Walgreens is getting a big boost from COVID-19 shots and tests. The drug store chain said Thursday it had administered nearly 16 million COVID-19 vaccinations and over 6 million tests in the latest quarter. That helped drive comparable retail sales up nearly 11%. Thatâs the highest in more than two decades. This comes as health authorities and governments worldwide push for more vaccinations and testing amid the fast spread of the Omicron variant. Walgreensâ quarterly earnings breezed past analystsâ estimates, and the retailer raised its profit growth forecast for the full year. But shares fell in early trading Thursday. As rivals such as Amazon seek to expand beyond the online pharmacy business, Walgreens has been diversifying its services beyond drugstores. It recently invested in companies that provide primary and home care.
